intro: Spallanzania corymbosa, commonly known as the flame flower, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Spallanzania corymbosa thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
